meanings.sent1: I will connect the puzzle pieces to complete the picture.
meanings.sent2: The bridge connects the two sides of the river.
meanings.sent3: I tried to connect the dots, but I kept drawing squiggles instead.
meanings.sent4: Her smile connected with everyone in the room, spreading joy.
meanings.sent5: The train tracks connect cities like veins in a body, keeping them alive.

meanings.definition: To establish a relationship or association
meanings.sent1: I hope to connect with my new classmates and make friends.
meanings.sent2: Networking events are a great way to connect with professionals in your field.
meanings.sent3: I tried to connect with the grumpy cat, but it just ignored me.
meanings.sent4: Their shared love for music connected them instantly, forming a bond.
meanings.sent5: The internet allows people from different countries to connect and share ideas effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To be related or linked in some way
meanings.sent1: The color of the walls should connect with the furniture in the room.
meanings.sent2: In this theory, happiness and health are connected to each other.
meanings.sent3: I never knew that my favorite book and the author were connected by a strange coincidence.
meanings.sent4: The old house and the mysterious key were connected in a way that unlocked a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky seem to connect with each other, forming beautiful constellations.
